A '''glowstone blob''' (also known as a '''glowstone cluster''') is a [[feature]] composed of [[glowstone]] that generates on the underside of terrain blocks in [[the Nether]].

== Description  ==
A glowstone blob consists of various tendrils of [[glowstone]] that extend outward from a central clump. Glowstone blobs serve as the main source of glowstone, which is a [[Light|light-emitting]] [[block]] that can be used to charge [[respawn anchor]]s. Mining glowstone without [[Silk Touch]] drops 2-4 [[glowstone dust]], which can then be crafted into a glowstone block.

== Generation  ==
Glowstone blobs form in coral-like structures on the underside of hanging [[netherrack]], found on the ceilings of the Nether including low-ceiling spaces such as caves or canyons. They cannot generate on any block other than netherrack. These blobs can intersect [[Nether fortress]]es and other structures during generation.

Glowstone blobs can be found in every Nether biome, although they are significantly rarer in [[soul sand valley]]s<ref>{{bug|MC-171520||Glowstone clusters cannot generate in Soul Sand Valley biomes|WAI}}</ref>, because the ceiling in this biome consists of [[soul sand]] and [[soul soil]].
